summary: The growing pressure on the United States to reduce its military presence in Iraq comes as strikes by the Islamic State are on the rise.

summary: President Bashar al-Assad faces threats he cannot bomb into submission, as protests erupt over living standards and a rift opens among the ruling elite.

title: University of Michigan to Drop Out as Presidential Debate Host

summary: Wildfires are spreading. The mosquitoes are ravenous. People are shielding their windows from the midnight sun with foil and blankets.

title: Nicolás Maduro Can’t Sell Venezuelan Gold at Bank of England, Court Rules
summary: It would be unlawful to allow Mr. Maduro access to the gold, a British High Court judge said, because Britain’s government recognizes his rival, Juan Guaidó, as Venezuela’s rightful leader.

summary: Assessing the virus’s real death rate could offer clues on what to expect next. Data shows how much harder the pandemic is hitting Black and Latino Americans.

summary: The number of daily global cases also broke a record, with the United States as the biggest source of new infections. The U.S. death toll is also on the rise.

title: Long-Planned and Bigger Than Thought: Strike on Iran’s Nuclear Program
summary: Some officials say that a joint American-Israeli strategy is evolving — some might argue regressing — to a series of short-of-war clandestine strikes.
